intro: Filaginella rossica, commonly known as the Russian filiclef, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold regions of northern Europe and Siberia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Filaginella rossica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in peat bogs and forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation to cold climates.
